Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVITY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number uniquely identifying each observationof an activity.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ACTIVITY DURATION: the total duration of this activity.
Column Comment.6: PRODUCT: The substance related to the activity, usually lost or other volumes duringspecial operations such as logging or testing.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVITY SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a valid set of activity codes, suchas those required by a regulatory or professional agency.
Column Comment.8: ACTIVITY TYPE: The type of activity that is tracked, such as drilling, testing, coring,tubing etc. May be any kind of activity related to well operations.
Column Comment.9: BASE DEPTH: The base depth at which this event or status occurred.
Column Comment.11: BASE STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT: the base stratigraphic unit for this event or status.
Column Comment.12: BLOWOUT FLUID: The type of fluid blown out of a well when a high pressure zone isencountered. For example gas, oil or water.
Column Comment.13: CONTROL DATE: The date that a well occurrence is brought under control.
Column Comment.14: CONTROL DEPTH: The measured depth to the point where the occurrence wasbrought under control.
Column Comment.16: REFERENCE WELL DOWNTIME TYPE: The type of downtime experienced during awell operation or event. Added to allow some granularity of describing downtimeevents without having to overload the event type table.
Column Comment.17: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.18: END DATE: The date that this event or activity ended or was completed.
Column Comment.19: END TIME: The time when this event or status was ended. Can often be calculatedvia duration.
Column Comment.20: END TIMEZONE: The timezone in which this event or status ended.
Column Comment.21: EVENT DATE: Date the specified event occurred.
Column Comment.22: EVENT DEPTH: The depth of the event if necessary.
Column Comment.23: EVENT DEPTH OUOM: Event depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.24: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.25: FINAL MUD DENSITY: Value of the mud density after an occurrence is broughtunder control.
Column Comment.27: FINAL MUD VISCOSITY: value of the mud viscosity after an occurrence is broughtunder control.
Column Comment.29: LITHOLOGY: Identifies describes the major lithologic types. For example sandstone,limestone, dolomite or shale.
Column Comment.30: SEVERITY: A valid list of severity types used for a qualifier of lost circulation or waterflow into the wellbore. For example minor or severe.
Column Comment.31: LOST MATERIAL AMOUNT: value for the amount of material added in treating thelost circulation interval.
Column Comment.33: LOST MATERIAL TYPE: The type of material used in treating a lost circulationinterval. For example cane, chicken feather, hay or walnut hulls.
Column Comment.34: LOST VOLUME: value for the volume of drilling fluid lost in a lost circulation interval.
Column Comment.36: LOST VOLUME PRODUCT: The product for which lost volumes are measured.
Column Comment.38: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.39: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.40: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.41: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.42: WELL STRING FORMATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observationnumber used to uniquely identify each completed (perforated) formation (layer) that iscontributing production to a well string.
Column Comment.43: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.44: REPORTED CODE: The reported status or activity code as received from the originalreport. This is an unvalidated value and is added to ensure that original reports canbe recreated as needed. Use DRILL ACTIVITY ID for the validated value.
Column Comment.45: REPORTED TIME ELAPSED: the elapsed time for this event or status as reportedon the original documentation.
Column Comment.47: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported depth of a well measuredvertically from the surface to the point of interest in the well bore. These reportedvalues may not represent the actual TVD as derivable from the directional survey andmay consequently be in error.
Column Comment.48: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.49: START DATE: The date that this activity or event started or was begun.
Column Comment.50: START MUD DENSITY: value for the mud density (measured weight per unit) of thedrilling mud before a well occurrence.
Column Comment.52: START MUD VISCOSITY: the viscosity (measured resistance to flowing) of thedrilling mud before an occurrence began.
Column Comment.54: START TIME: the time of day that the event started, such as 1:30 p.m. EDT
Column Comment.55: START TIMEZONE: The timezone of the starting time for this event or status.
Column Comment.56: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.57: TOP DEPTH: the top depth for this event or status.
Column Comment.59: TOP STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT: The top stratigraphic unit for this event or status.
Column Comment.60: TOTAL TIME ELAPSED: the total time for this event or status. This may differ fromthe DURATION or elapsed time (clock time from start to finish) in that an event maynot occupy all of a period.
Column Comment.62: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.63: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.64: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.65: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.66: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.67: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.68: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
